alert.note: Alert for Northern Litchfield; Southern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:14PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Litchfield, southwestern Berkshire, northeastern Ulster, Dutchess, Columbia and southeastern Greene Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Milton to Cornwall Bridge. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Torrington, New Milford, Kingston, Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Sherman, Rhinebeck, Pawling, Chatham, Hyde Park, Pleasant Valley, Thomaston, Hurley, Claverack, Woodstock, Amenia, Livingston, Copake and Sheffield. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
